Description: American-Amicable agreed to pay $60 million to a group of states to resolve allegations that it violated insurance and consumer protection regulations in the marketing of life insurance policies to U.S. military personnel. The company separately paid $10 million in a related case brought by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-american-amicable-life-insurance-company
Info Source: INSURANCE DIRECTOR ANN BENJAMIN ANNOUNCES $70 MILLION NATIONAL SETTLEMENT BENEFIT FOR OHIO MILITARY PERSONNEL, US States News, August 4, 2006 (via Nexis).
